alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 2:18PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE SUMMIT TRAIL BURN SCAR... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall on the Summit Trail burn scar is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Ferry. * WHEN...Until 530 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Carson Creek, Grizzly Creek, Sitdown Creek, Onion Creek, Barnaby Creek, Johns Mountain Creek, North Fork Hall Creek, Hall Creek, Lynx Creek and Sleepy Hollow Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Inchelium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
